issues: Coordinate mismatch: 2.54 km distance between asserted coordinates (46.254613, -89.512657) and geocoded location coordinates (46.232455, -89.5204851)
Environmental complexity: Multiple conflicting land cover classifications (deciduous vs mixed forest) from different systems
Missing ecosystem/ecosystem_category fields while other study samples have these populated
Schema compliance: geo_loc_name format follows expected pattern but coordinate discrepancy suggests potential location uncertainty
Soil type classification shows podzol which is appropriate for northern temperate forest but conflicts with M horizon designation typically associated with organic layers
recommendations: Verify and reconcile coordinate discrepancy - determine which coordinates are more accurate (asserted vs geocoded)
Standardize land cover classification by selecting the most appropriate single system rather than conflicting multiple classifications
Populate missing ecosystem and ecosystem_category fields for consistency with study design (suggest 'Environmental' and 'Terrestrial' based on other samples)
Consider updating soil horizon classification to align with podzol soil type identification
Add quality flags to indicate coordinate uncertainty and multiple land cover interpretations
Cross-reference with NEON site documentation to validate exact sampling coordinates
